Class ActorManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.managers.ActorManager
public class ActorManager extends Object
Manager class for handling various actor-related operations such as updating, removing, and managing collisions of actors.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ActorManager(javafx.scene.Group root)
    Constructs an ActorManager with the specified root group.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    handleCollisions(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors1, List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors2, RedScreenEffect hitEffect, UserPlane user)
    Handles collisions between two lists of actors.
    void
    removeDestroyedActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
    Removes destroyed actors from the provided list and from the root group's children.
    void
    updateActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
    Updates the state of all actors in the provided list.

  • Constructor Details

    • ActorManager

      public ActorManager(javafx.scene.Group root)
      Constructs an ActorManager with the specified root group.
      Parameters:
      root - the root group that contains the visual elements of the actors

  • Method Details

    • updateActors

      public void updateActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
      Updates the state of all actors in the provided list.
      Parameters:
      actors - the list of actors to update

    • removeDestroyedActors

      public void removeDestroyedActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
      Removes destroyed actors from the provided list and from the root group's children.
      Parameters:
      actors - the list of actors to check and remove if destroyed

    • handleCollisions

      public void handleCollisions(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors1, List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors2, RedScreenEffect hitEffect, UserPlane user)
      Handles collisions between two lists of actors. If a collision is detected, actors take damage, and if a user plane is involved in the collision, a red screen effect is triggered.
      Parameters:
      actors1 - the first list of actors to check for collisions
      actors2 - the second list of actors to check for collisions
      hitEffect - the visual effect triggered on collision
      user - the user plane involved in potential collisions
